issues.title: Select window on hover
issues.body:
I would like windows to be selected on hover rather than on click, making it easier to find the window I want.

This would serve a similar purpose to opacify I think, but it would work without compiz and be more what I want anyway.

issues.title: Switching to app shouldn't open minimized windows
issues.body:
If I have some windows minimized for a certain app and I switch to it by clicking its icon in the dock, all minimized windows get un-minimized and open with the other ones.

Minimized windows should stay minimized/be ignored when one switches apps.

issues.title: Problems with "Ignore windows on other workspaces"
issues.body:
Hey, I am recently checking out dockbarx and really like it so far. I typically hide windows of other workspaces in my taskbar and was happy to see such an option in dockbarx.

Unfortunately I encountered some errors using this option. Selecting applications from a different workspace is still possible using the `<Super>-<Tab>` keyboard combination and behaves strangely. Sometimes the application is moved to the current workspace, sometimes a new instance is launched. Using `<Super>-<Number>` has similar issues for me.

The attached screenshot shows the selecting of _hidden_ windows using `<Super>-<Tab>`.

I am using the version provided in the ppa for Wily:

```
> dockx --version
DockbarX 0.92
```

![screenshot_2016-06-14_20-02-50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/328798/16053905/070f42b8-326b-11e6-8a98-bebd5514cca4.png)

issues.title: Minimize Animation Glitch (Issue)
issues.body:
In XFCE if you have (for example) Compiz Reloaded running to enable animations and you open an application that isn't already on the panel-dock, then minimize an application that was already open before you opened the new app, the minimize animations happens to the location of the app before the extra one was opened.

A clearer example of this is if I have Firefox open and then open up a new application that isn't pinned and then I go back to minimize Firefox, it doesn't minimize directly into the icon, it minimises to where the icon used to be.

If this could be fixed I would very much appreciate that!

issues.title: Dock Applets don't work
issues.body:
Dock Applets don't work at all. Tested in Ubuntu 16.04 and 14.04 with both the latest DockBarX 0.92 and 0.91.4. 

All the applets I enable are reset when I close and reopen the DOckBarX preferences. There's no terminal output to indicate anything related to this.

issues.title: Redesign of the preferences dialog
issues.body:
# Redesign of the preferences dialog

The preferences dialog of DockbarX has been around for a while and gone through quite a few changes. While DockbarX has gotten more and more features the preferences dialog has become more and more crowded with options, to the point where the dialog can feel quite intimidating to new users. It is perhaps time to rewrite it from scratch to make it easier to understand. Now I need **your** help to get it done.
### Mock ups

Send mock ups of how you would like the preference dialog to be rearranged to be easier to use and understand. Let your creativity flow freely as long as you remember that the key focus is on making something that is _easier to use_.
### Language

English isn't my native language and I have a bit of a  fondness for playing with words which doesn't always help when you need to write short informative sentences. Help me improve the wording in the texts to make the language more clear. This will help not only the end user, but also the translators who will have an easier job of translating when they don't have to start by guessing what the original text really means.
### Opinions

Even if you can't make mock ups or don't speak English well enough to improve the language you can share your opinions of what things in the dialog you find most confusing and what you think should be changed.

Below are screenshots of how DockbarX preferences dialog looks like right now in untranslated English. Some options (regrettably far from all of them) have tooltips. Sadly they don't show up on screenshots.  
![dbx preference page 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467464/3016e8de-0291-11e4-80a9-fb4c3ac4ab88.png)
![dbx preference page 2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467465/3017493c-0291-11e4-8d93-7c9d21e7c89c.png)
![dbx preference page 3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467466/3018f9b2-0291-11e4-933f-90ef3d77f6ac.png)

![dbx preference page 5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467468/301c2740-0291-11e4-98a1-c5d5512efadf.png)
![dbx preference page 6](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467469/301c6764-0291-11e4-8b97-903b251bb220.png)
![dbx preference page 7](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467471/302ea668-0291-11e4-9b40-98fb609ed3b4.png)
![dbx preference page 8](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7893626/3467470/302eac9e-0291-11e4-8682-442acb0aabd3.png)

commit.message:
Better behavior for Desktop Actions

Launch "quicklist" (Desktop Action) Execs them the same way we launch
normal Execs.  Makes it so Firefox's "New Window" action doesn't open
http://www.%u.com/.  I am sure this solves similar issues with other
software too.

I preserved API backwards compatibility, but it may be sensible to
refactor this.

Don't use the full command line as an identifier

Variation on 26570a7 as explained.  Unknown effects on behavior.

Only fallback to cmd identifier when needed

Using the cmd identifier is quite problematic.  If it contains null
bytes, it will result in an error farther down the line, causing the
group not to be shown!  This change makes cmd act in the same way as the
window title, in that res_class and res_name are preferred.

It is probably wise to split cmd by null bytes and choose only the first
one, but since I am unsure of all the potential ramifications of such a
change (would it be better to replace null bytes with spaces?) and
because this change fixes the problem for me, I will not include that in
this commit.

Merge branch 'hotfix-0.91.1'
Bumped version number to 0.91.1
Fixed Bug #1331820 (lp): DockX showed arrows instead of adjusting its width or height.
Updated README.md and README, small changes.
Updated README.md and README, small problems.
Added README.md
Updated README and added markdown.

Version 0.91
- Bug #1316501 and #1329240: Xfce4-terminal was unpinable and had the wrong icon in Xubuntu.
- Fixed small bug regarding handling of groups without a desktopentry.
- README and CHANGELOG updated.
- Fixed a bug that broke certain menu options (like unpin application) if zeitgeist was not installed. Last commit reverted and a new fix is done.
- Fixed a bug that broke certain menu options (like unpin application) if zeitgeist was not installed.
- DockbarX now checks for gnome-desktop-item-edit or exo-desktop-item edit and uses the one installed when editing launchers instead of just assuming that gnome-desktop-item-edit is installed.

- Improved code separation: everything specific to gnomeapplet is moved out of dockbar.py and into dockbar_factory. The dockbar class is also not acting differently depending on if it is runned in dockx, awn or gnome panel, instead it needs to be instructed by the calling class on how to act.
- The awn applet has been broken since size overflow management was introduced. It works again now (but it can't still manage size overflow).

- Improved code separation: everything specific to gnomeapplet is moved out of dockbar.py and into dockbar_factory. The dockbar class is also not acting differently depending on if it is runned in dockx, awn or gnome panel, instead it needs to be instructed by the calling class on how to act.
- The awn applet has been broken since size overflow management was introduced. It works again now (but it can't still manage size overflow).
- Made battery applet work with UPower 0.99 and later.
- Fixed a bug that filled up the log with source ID warnings.
- The battery applet added some empty space underneat it when the dock was reloaded (only on vertical docks). Fixed.

- The dock behaves in a more sane way when a namebar, window title or two spacer applets are used (it looks like it did before the size overflow feature were added.
- Some code clean up in dockx file.
- Added some possible paths for the appindicator-service bin. The appindicator applet should start the service correctly for Ubuntu 14.04 now.
- Made dockbarx expand when used as a gnome applet since dockbarx can't handle situations when the icons overflow the screen space otherwise.

- Removed some ugly CairoSurface to gkd.Pixbuf transformations by using PIL instead of pixbufs in a couple of functions. Could possibly speed up DockbarX ever so slightly or reduce memory foot print by a small amount (since cstringIO is no longer imported).

- Changed all python files to execute /usr/bin/python2 instead of /usr/bin/python.
- Bug #1314868: Random junkpixels were shown around icons in some themes when a newer version of the library pillow (or PIL?) was used. Fixed.

- Bug #652386 and Bug #1120940: DockbarX do anything - or worse since a few versions back it froze - when too many windows of a program was opened so that the window list didn't fit the screen. Now the window list gets a scrollbar instead when it would become too big to fit the screen.
- Bug #1272106: Pillow is replacing imaging. A quick fix for gentoo (and other?) users.

- DockbarX can now handle situations where there are more groupbuttons than can fit on the screen.
- Small code cleanups and some comments added.

- Added Battery Status applet.
- Fixed a small bug in Appindicator applet.
- Appindicators now store previously used icons in cache to prevent slowdowns (or even freezes of the whole dock) when a appinicator quickly changes icons frequently to animate the indicator.
- Last commit broke appindicator menus. Fixed.

- Zeitgeist dbus calls are done async.
- Locked window list is now called floating window panel instead. Hopefully that makes more sense.
- Code cleanup in menu related and zeitgeist code.

- Made some (perhaps that last) synced dbus calls asynced.
- Small code cleanups.
- Fixed two small appindicator applet (and gtk style menu) bugs.
- (Possible) fix for bug #865836: windows doesn't disappear from the list on multi monitor setups.
Bug #1071063: Changes in DockbarX 0.90 had broken DockbarX AWN applet.

- Bug #1070441: Application indicators didn't work for ubuntu 11.04 (still doesn't for ubuntu 10.4). I also removed some arguments from dbus command Watch since they shouldn't be there in the first place and caused error messages in 11.04.
- changed default behaviour for namebar from showing only for maximized windows to always show.

Version 0.90.3
- Updated version numbers and CHANGELOG.

- Added volume-control applet to setup.py so it gets installed.
- Fixed a bug that stopped volume-control from starting.

Version 0.90.2
- CHANGELOG and version numbers updated.
- Appindicator applet is updated to support older versions of application-indicator-service (used in ubuntu 11.10).
- Appindicator applet updated so that it can start indicator-application-service in ubuntu 12.10. The file was moved to another directory in this version.

Version 0.90.1
- README, CHANGELOG and version numbers are updated.
- Translations are updated.
- Added launcher for DockX.

- Small change to where appindicator menu pops up.
- App indicator icon size is set to 18 instead of 16.

- Appindicator menus no longer pop up at mouse pointer location but next to the dock, more like they do in unity.
- Fixed a little visual glitch caused by the last bug fix.
- Removed some left over print statements from the code.
- Fix for Bug #970737: DockX background disappears on mouse over with cairo 1.12
- Fixed bug #1066875: Visual glitches in right click menu for ubuntu 12.10 (compiz bug).
- The default theme is now for real Glassified. Forgot to change that earlier.
- A little (possible) bugfix perhaps related to Bug #1066875.
- Changed setup so that namebar themes are installed in the right folder.

Version 0.90
- README, CHANGELOG and version numbers updated.
- Translation template updated.
- Clock appet fixed so that its preferences dialog works again.

- Theme making: rotation can be applied directly when using composite command by setting the option angle. The rotate command has also gotten a new option: resize. If it is set to True the pixmap will be resized so that the whole rotated image is visible instead of cuting of the corners of the image.
- Theme making: To make it easier to make themes that works up, down, left and right sets are added. A set lets you define different values for left, right, up and down that can be used in xoffets, yoffsets and angles by writing the offset name instead of a number.
- Dock theme making: If strech_bg_img is set to 1 the dock theme background image will be streched to the height of the dock for horizontal docks or to the width of the dock for vertical docks.
- Glass DMD is updated to look more correct when used verticallly.
- DBX Preferences behaves more correctly if it can't find the theme it should use.
- Changed some theme infos.
- Changed theme DockXYZ so that it scales down to small sizes better.

- The themes can be set to behave differently depending on orienteation (left, right, up, down).
- Images used in themes can be rotated now (for now it works best with square images).
- Sizes in themes can be set in both percentage and pixels (or a combination of both.
- All bundled themes are updated to work on vertical docks and panels. DockXYZ and Colors behaves differently depending on which side of the screen they are on as well.

- New themes, popup styles and dock themes are added. Old ones are removed.
- The appearence tab of dockbarx preferences is changed visually to be easier to use.
- A small bug making preferences crash when a theme can't be found is fixed.
- Two bugs in appindictaor applet are fixed.

- Mediaplayer buttons (in the window list) are now using async dbus calls. Slowstarters like spotify should no longer freeze DockbarX for a few seconds.
- Two small spotify dbus bugs worked around.
- Removed the non-ASCII char from my name in the copyright notice of the volume control applet. (I really must stop doing that kind of small but breaking changes just before committing. Sorry.)

- A volume applet is added (ported from awn).
- Appindicator works on vertical docks now.
- Update command added to Applets. It the method is called when the dock changes.
- Fixed a bug in appindicator applet that stopped icon and label changes.
- Forgot to update setup.py. Fixed.

- Added an AppIndicator applet.
- Fixed a small dbus signal removing bug in dbusmenu used by unity quicklists and appindicators.
- The last change to the applet system broke the applet preference dialog (for now only used by clock applet). This is fixed now.
- Forgot to update setup.py.

- Changed the applet system. An applet concists of a .applet and a .py file now. This change was made so that DockbarX doesn't have to load every applet just to check their name. Now it only loads those applets that are shown.
- Added the namebar themes.

- DockX applets can now be placed in the middle of the dock as well as in both ends (there are two spacer applets in the list now).
- Namebar makes a reapperance as a DockX applet. It is also split up in two separate applets, Window title and Window buttons to allow for more flexibility.
- Applets can now be expandable (replace a spacer applet). Namebar uses this feature.
- DockbarX themes can now have a info file in them that explains how the theme is intended to be used and gives suggestions on color options and so on. The text of this file is shown when pressing the new info button that is shown next to the theme name in the preferences. All themes that are shipped with dockbarx or the theme pack should have a info text starting from the next release.
- Fixed a bug in cardapio applet that caused the dock to crash on reloads.

- The standalone dock now supports applets.
- A clock applet is added. Besides setting color and font it also supports gnome-panel custom clock stings to set custom looks. Clicking it opens orage calendar if installed but behavior can be changed by editing the gconf key /apps/dockbarx/applets/coommand.
- A cardapio launcher button. Requires cardapio to work.

- Removed the window list alignment option from preference dialog since very few people use it and the option is confusing for people that uses vertical panels/docks. The alignment can still be set from gconf-editor (/apps/dockbarx/popup_align).
- It's possible to set the width of window titles in the window list now, if previews are not used.
- Bug #854551 again: dockbarx fails to recognize windows moved to another workspace.
Version 0.48
- Translations updated.

- Added tooltip text to option "show previews for minimized windows".
- Updated translate template.

- Added tooltip text to option "show previews for minimized windows".
- Updated translate template.

- Added option to enable/disable the preview workaround when windows are minimized (only for compiz 0.9 and above).
- Icons are back in place of previews when windows are minimized if previews for minimized windows are disabled or compiz older than 0.9 are used.
- Translation template updated.

- When dropping a launcher on the left half of a group button the new launcher will turn up on the left side of the button instead for on the right side. This means that it's finally possible to drop launchers on position furthest to the right (or at the top of a vertical panel/dock). Closes bug #619937.
- Bug #854561: DockbarX fails to show the selected window when using drag and drop.
- Bug #854551: DockbarX failed to recognize windows moved to another workspace.
- Bug fix: Themes couldn't choose default popup styles if the style file name contained upper case letters.
- Bug #837711: DockX repositioned when unhiding.
- Fixed bug where the shape mask of the dock didn't update after a change from Non compositing window managers to compositing window managers.
- Previews are now resized correctly when preview size or window geometry changes.
- Workaround for wrong height on previews in compiz 0.9.x
- Workaround for the compiz preview bug. If compiz 0.9.x is used the window list will have a hole where the preview is supposed to show so that it won't look like it's behind the preview.
Version 0.47

- Close button size can be set from popup_style.
- Popup style spaced is updated with a closebutton that doesn't look as awful as the last one.
- Bug fix: The padding for popups didn't change automatically every time when the popup style changed.

- Popup styles can now be limited to certain themes. This will make it possible for theme makers to make a style that fits their theme perfectly without having to worry about cluttering the popup style list for people that uses other themes.

- linear gradients added to the dock theming. See theme folded.
- Fixed a small bug in linear gradients for popup styles.
- Cleanup: Removed two unnecessary print commands that cluttered the log
- The way linear gradients is added to popup styles is changed. It doesn't depend on absolute pixel values anymore so it will scale with the size of the popup.

- The popup styles are updated with example code and pictures for the close button (see sqare and spaced). 
- A small bug regarding close_button_roundness fixed.

- Bug #844967: The dock didn't reposition on screen resolution changes.
- The dock position is now updated every time it's allocation changes. Should fix bugs such as misplaced docks after running mplayer (and other programs?) in full screen and Bug #837711 (hopefully).

- Closebuttons can be made from png files now. Examples to come.
- Bug #847382: The dock didn't start under some circumstances.

- Added the dock themes to bzr... sorry.
- Made close button style-able (it's part of the popup style). Example code will be added to the popup styles soon.
- Minor code cleanup.

- The dock is themable now. The themes are written in a similar way as popup styles. Look inside one of the theme files to get more information on how it's done. Quite a few changes had to be done to the dock to get this working so please bug report any visaul glitch, problems in writing themes or anything else related to the dock.
- Bug #833335 and #834804: The awn applet didn't remove icons on window closuers.

- The window list is themeable now. You can select different styles for the window list from appearence tab. The styles are independet parts of the themes. They exist in .dockbarx/themes/popup_styles or /usr/share/dockbarx/themes/popup_styles. They are .tar.gz files and should contain one style file with all the settings  and optionally one background.png picture. Making styles should be very easy compared to making themes. Look inside any of the styles that comes with DockbarX, the style file is heavily commented. Themes can set which style they want to use as default and the default colors of the window list is still set from the theme.
- The window list no longer use colored fonts to signal wheter a window is active or needs attention. It uses colored backgrounds instead.
Version 0.46.1
- Removed a workround for OpenOffice/LibreOffice recent files that was made long ago time ago and was not needed anymore.
- Bug #809080 fixed (again... because 'not' is an importat word).

Version 0.46
- Version numbers and changelog updated.
- Fixed bug: Related files worked only for applications with only one mime-type. Perhaps the feature will show itself useful now when this bug is fixed.
- Imported updated tranlations.
- Improved the workround for the bug in dbus-python (see rev 436). It hopefully should actually work now.
- Updated the translation template.

- Options to dodge windows or active window added to DockbarX awn applet since they intellihide and avoid windows doesn't work in awn unless the taskmanager is running.
- AWN isn't hiding anymore while a dockbarx awn applet window list is howered.
- Small code cleanup.

- Removed dock options autohide and allow dock to overlap windows and added five different behaviors instead: panel, standard, dogde windows, dodge active window and always autohide.
- Fixed a bug that made the drop-down selection options in dock page in preference not to work if they were translated.
- Fixed dodge window for multiple workspaces.
- Small cleanup. Using int(round(floatnumber)) instead of int(floatnumber + 0.4).
- Workround for what I believe is a bug in python-dbus. Counters (for example unityfox download counter) showed big negative numbers instead ofa low number (the numbres of downloads).

- Added dynamic unity quicklists (previously DockbarX could handle only static quicklists).
- Dockmanager or unity launchers can signal that a group needs attention now.
- Badge and progress colors and bagde font and size can be set from the appearence page of preference. Unity counters, progress bars etc. can be turned of from plugins page.
- Badges now resizes them selves if they are too wide. If no custom font and size is chosen the badge font size is set to a quarter of the group button height.
- A badge or progress bar set by dockmanager should not be removed by unity or vice versa (they can still replace each other though, just not set no visible badge or progress bar).

- Unity launcher badges and progress bars are supported. Options (on/off and colors) are comming later. To make it work dockbarx has to pretend it's unity so don't try to start unity while dockbarx is running (or do and report the effects to me).
- Dockmanager progressbar support.
- Badges has gotten a facelift.

- Changed the way the dock is placed. For example if the dock is positioned on the bottom and a gnomepanel is placed at the bottom as well, the dock won't try to move itself higher up on the screen to avoid overlapping. I think this is a more useful behavior as it allows placing the dock in one corner and a panel in another corner along the same edge.

- Added uniqe d-bus addresses for dockbarx and the dock.
- The preference window is only showing the dock tab if the actually dock is running.

- Fixed bug #809080: closed apps were shown as running in the dock when not using autohide.
- Fixed some problems with docks positioned to the right showning up to the left when autohide is activated/deactivated.

- The dock autohide is dogding windows now. I replaced the old autohide behavior instead of adding it as an option. If there's anyone out there who likes 'always hide' autohiding, please tell me and I will add the option.
- In agreement with the creator Izobalax I changed the license for the gaia theme to CC 3.0 BY-SA so that it can be included in the debian package. (Sorry for the huge delay, I thought I changed it already months ago.)
- Another fix for Bug #806990. This one works for me.
- The mouse cursor is changed during launching for the popup as well. (Bug #615968)
- Yet another fix attempt for Bug #806990.
- Reverted the last commit since it didn't work and crashed DockbarX.
- Another fix for Bug #806990.
- The mouse cursor is changed during launching. (Bug #615968)
- Possible fix for Bug #806990: DockbarX crashes after closing libreoffice calc.
- Bug #779564: DockbarX makes all windows with opacity 0

Version 0.45
- The autohidden dock shows when dockbarx keyboard shortcuts are used.
- CHANGELOG and version numbers changed.
- Another try at Bug #801580.
- A small change to how the identifier for openoffice/libreoffice is chosen. Only matter if you have both installed or in case of weird errors.
- Bug #769110: Opacify didn't work (compiz 0.8.x).
- Autohiding caused blinking of the dock when the pointer was placed along the screen edge outside of the dock. Fixed.
- Added autohide option to the dock.
- Bug #801580: Custom created launchers disappeared after restart.
- Bug #801361: DockbarX crashed because of an coding error.
- Bug #743749: Too little error handling stopped group buttons from showing if there were errors in the translations (because of a bug in gettext).
- Bug #784307: DockbarX couldn't correctly handle multiple instances if some instances were horizontal and some vertical.

- Bug fix: Qucklists menu items were in random order.
- Bug fix: Group buttons didn't disappear when the application closed.
- Bug fix: Show popup option for select action didn't work.

- The install instructions in readme missed the dependency python-imaging.
- Small bug that made dockbarx chrash because of faulty themes fixed.

Version 0.44
- Updated version number, readme and changelog.
- Updated translations.
- Translate template updated.
- Offset option for the dock so that you manually can aviod overlapping with other panels if the dock doesn't do it automatically.
- Bugfix: The dock was placed outside the screen if used in top position on dualscreens that weren't top aligned with eachother.
- A fix for problems when the dock was used on the 'middle edge' on a dualscreen.
- Small bug in rev 402 fixed.

- The dock should work better with multiple monitors now. The monitor number should be sett from command line: dockx --monitor 1
- The setting Allow maximized windows behind is added to dockbarx preference.

- Drag and drop to empty spaces in DockX works now.
- The _net_wm_strut_partial property of the dock is changed the size of dock changes in corner and centered modes.
- Updated the translation template.
- Preference option to enable/disable number shortcuts.

- More radical changes to the way DockbarX starts. Please report regressions.
- The earlier commit that broke dockx broke dockbarx AWN applet as well. Fixed.

- Last commit broke dockx. Now it works again.
- I changed the way DockbarX starts when used as gnome panel applet. It might stop dockbarx from not starting up correctly sometimes, but with a bit of bad luck it can have made the problem worse instead. Please report any regressions.

- A possible fix for bug #688442, window lists shown on the wrong monitor when using dual screen. DockbarX now checks which monitor it's on when every time it needs that info instead of just checking once when DockbarX is starting/reloading.
- Preference option for using quicklists.
- Fixed a bug in quicklists.

- Fixed some bugs with the new number shortcuts and cleaned up the code a bit.
- Reversed the changes concerning the gtk warnings in rev 393 since it made dockbarx act wierdly under metacity.

- Groups can now be selected with shortcuts (super + number).
- DockX writes to the log now.
- Removed some unnecessary gtk warnings the cluttered the log.
- Support for unity quicklists added.
- Added a corner mode to the dock and fixed some dock related bugs in the process.
- The border pixel closest to the border of the centered dock  wasn't stroked.

- The dock has two modes now, panel and centered.
- Fixed a visual bug when using the dock in Natty with the Ambiance theme.
- Updated the translation template.

- Bug #775852: Compiz scale and switch didn't work with newer versions of compiz. Patch by BlackDex.
- Bug #775884: minimize all and maximize all didn't work.

- Chromium and chrome apps should now get their own groupbutton and should be pinnable and recognized on drag and drop. There might still be bugs here, please report any.
- Bug fix: the window list wasn't rotated when changed from horizontal to vertical panel.
- Bugfix: DockbarX acted wierdly if 'show previews' was False when DockbarX where loaded.
- Bug fix: Double click actions work again.
- Bug #769535 again.
- Bug #769535: Compiz scale and scroll switching broken.

- Locked list (give better name suggestions, please) works for panels placed elsewhere than at the bottom of the screen. For top/left/right panels the locked list will be placed in the middle of the bottom of the screen.
- Locked lists can avoid overlapping with maximized windows the option is in the window list tab of DockbarX preference.
- Some small bug fixes.

- New feature: Locked mini list. If more than one window is opened of a program you can select 'locked list' (somebody, please suggest a better name for it). A small list of the windows of the program will then be shown constantly over the panel. It is useful only for horisontal panels/docks for now but that will change shortly.
- Bug 769109: DockbarX depended on gnomeapplet even if runned in AWN or as stand-alone dock.
- Bug 769535: Select next window didn't work. (Other parts of that bug might still persist.)
- Bug: Gtk (old style) group menu didn't show up where it was supposed to. 
- Some other small bug fixes.
- Fixed bug that stopped enabling previews from working.

- DockbarX can now run as a stand alone dock. It not meant to be an all-in-one dock with bells and whistles. Just a light-weight way to run dockbarx in gnome3 (not tested) or to build an environment together with other panels like wingpanel. For now only expanded panel mode exists. Run it by typing dockx.
- Fixed a bug that stop DockbarX AWN applet from working and made DockbarX crash when changing between horizontal and vertical panel.
- Updated the translation template.

- Big code reordering. This has taken forever todo and will probably still hold a few bugs. Please do bug hunt.
- Moving group buttons behaves slightly differently now. The button you move doesn't hide anymore (the old behavior caused too many potential bugs).
- Some uninformative logging entries are removed.

- When using keyboard shortcuts too choose window the selection isn't done until the mod key is released.
- Fixed some problems with shift+tab key combos. I hope all system works the same way so that I didn't break things for others to get it working on my computer.
- DockbarX button size is changed in awn when compensation is changed.
- Bug #714402: Next group keyboard shortcut if gconf option for skipping launchers was selected.
- A better fix for Bug #714505
- Bug #714505: Dockbarx does not manage windows when running Matlab Simulink.
- Bug #715861: Group menu didn't work for unrecognised groups.
- Readme updated.

Version 0.43
- Changelog, Readme and version number updated.
- Translation templates updated again since they accidentally got overwritten by older ones.
- Updated translations
- Removed .py from dockbarx_factory.py and dbx_preference.py since debian doesn't allow file extensions in /usr/bin.
- Translation template updated.
- Bug fix: DockbarX opened wrong file you had multiple files with the same name in recent or most used menu.
- Improved DockbarX ability to deal with situations where another dock has requested the dbus name net.launchpad.DockManager already.

- Bug #712288: Groupbutton menu doesn't work when DockManager is disabled.
- Made quod libet pinnable.

- Bug #701014: Zeitgeist errors not catched correctly.
- Fixed a possible problem with unescaped popup titles.
- The badge font can now be set from preference window.
- Added error handling for restarting of DockManager helpers.
- Prism apps are now separated from eachother.
- Button for accessing helpers (DockManager preferences) added in preference dialog.
- Added error handling for starting dockmanager.
- Preference dialog options for mediabuttons and dockmanager. I called the tab 'Plugins' though they technically aren't plugins. Sugestions for better names are welcome.
- Fixed a bug where previews didn't move to their new spot and stayed outside of the popup when windows were closed.
- gconf options to turn of dockmanager, dockmanager badge and media buttons. Preference dialog will be updated soon.
- Added a very simple implementation of dockmanager badges. Will later add possibility to turn it off and perhaps make it more easy on eyes.
- Fixed small bug: Menu items became bigger when clicked on.
- Small bug fixed (thanks to new log system).
- Logging added to dockbarx. Logfiles can be found in ~/.dockbarx/log. No logging to file is done when dockbarx runs in windows. Please commit log when reporting bugs.

- Fixed a visible background color (black) for mouse over on window items for computers without compositing. Computers with compositing still uses the same color as for the popup but with more opacity.
- Changed the roundness for window items to match the inner side of the popup border roundness (roundness=5) instead of matching the avarage roundness of the border (roundness=6).
- Added a couple pixels more padding at the sides for menu items.
- Bugfix: DockbarX restarted dockmanager helpers when DockbarX orientation was set instead for restarting them when DockbarX reloaded.
- Dockmanager plugins are restarted when dockbarx is reloaded.
- Menu items works again.

- Added dockmanager.py file.
- Removed some unnecessary output.

- DockManager support. To test it, install dockmanager and run dockmanager-settings to enable the helpers. Only menu items are supported for now, no badges.
- Bug 702614: Window opacify doesnt wor.
- Bug 694866: Needs attention doesnt work.

- Bug #702614: Opacify didn't work.
- Two small bugs that stopped dockbarx from running in awn and in window.

- Bug #702639: rhythmbox was not recognized after raised form tray.
- Code cleanup.
- Bug #702635: DockbarX does not change workspace.
Bug #701773:Openoffice special handling wasn't used for libreoffice. Patch by Mark Baas.

- When clicking on a pinned mediaplayer that is minimized to tray, the window is raised withdbus instead of being launched again. This makes it possible to get spotify linux to show when minimized to tray without using the notification area (yes, launching spotify again doesn't raise it for some reason).
- Code cleanup: private functions starts with double underscore and some other stuff. Please test all kinds of stuff to check that I didn't break anything.

- Bug 694866 fixed (this should be it I hope).
- Media buttons should not be above the window list when a media player in unminimized from tray.

- Bug #698281: banshee has no media buttons.
- The risk of memory leaks because of media buttons is deminished.
- A small bug that might be connected with Bug #694866 (or not) is fixed.
- Code cleanup.

- Possible fix for Bug #694866: Needs attention refused to shut down.
- Some code cleanup.

- Added mediabuttons. It uses mpris2 and should work for all media players that appears in ubuntus sound menu (if not write a bug report). The media buttons should show for pinned music players without windows as well, if the music player is running.
- Small writing error in changelog fixed.

Version 0.42.1
- Changelog and version number updated.
- Bug fix: Close and close all option in the menu didn't work.
- Close button is now optional.

Version 0.42
- Changelog, version number and translations updated.
- Popups on vertical panels are no longer horizontally top aligned with the group button, instead are vertical popups placed in such way that the arrow splits height according to the golden ratio.
- Small visual bug in previews fixed.
- Previews are now turned off when the group list gets too big to fit the screen.

- The max size for previews are now different in height and width. For height, it's the size set in preference dialog, for width it's that size times the aspect area for the monitor. This gives a more even height for the previews and consequently less padding when you have more than one window in a group.
- It's now possible to use the old gtk menu again instead of the new dockbarx menu. The option is in the appearance tab.
- Bug #688953 fixed: Some symbols made window titles looks like gibberish because the titles weren't escaped before the were markuped.

- Opacify code rewritten again. It now supports fades when switching from one opacified window to another. You can turn off or fine tune the fades from preference dialog.
- Other small bug fixes in the opacify code.
- Another small bug caused by the new Opacify code fixed.
- Fade in and fade out added for Opacify.

- Select next and select previous group button actions are rewritten. They now optionally use opacify and a delay instead of just selecting the next/previous window immediately. (Feature codename: Scrollpeak)
- Keyboard selecting is also improved in the same way as Select Next/Previous and you can now also start programs using the "Select [next/previous] groupbutton" keyboard command.
- Some bugs connected to the opacify changes in previous revision are fixed.
- Prefence dialog starts again (previous revision broke it)
- Correct detection of whether pointer is inside the popup or not. Should deminish problems with popups that don't disappear as they are supposed to.
- Default left-click action for groupbuttons are set to "select or minimize all" instead of "select all".
- Bug #690731: With vertical panels the window lists were partly outside the screen when the groupbutton was near the bottom of the screen.
- Code cleanup.
- Opacify is rewritten. It should be more stable now and opcaify group behavior should be more intuitive now.
- Bug #687251: DockBarX cannot create custom launchers

Version 0.41
- README and CHANGELOG updated.
- New translations added.
- Changed the default behavior for closing groups from double-middle click to middle-click.
- Bug fix: Previews didn't always show up as they should.
- Bug #684537: If a pinned app had no executable command DockbarX didn't add the application to the bar.
- Bug #686059: No de-opacify happened when the close button was clicked.
- All epandable submenus (like latest and most used menus) are automatically unexpanded when the menu is closed. Makes more sense that way IMHO.

- Unnecessary padding around previews are removed.
- Code clean-up: Window item handling and window item looks are handled in different classes.

- Changed the look of the popup button to something less ugly.
- Bug: Two right click menus were sometimes visible at once. Fixed.
- Added shape-combine mask for the popup windows so that they wouldn't overlap the group button so much.
- Added a (first version of a) close button to the windows items.

- Menu got a face lift.
- Visual bugs on previews caused by compiz inablity to handle two previews at once (even for a fraction of a second) is fixed by avoiding having two popups open at once even for a fraction of a second.
- That ugly grey border the font in window list items when using the gtk themes Ambiance or Radiance is removed.
- A bug in iconfactory.py caused DockbarX in AWN to show up empty.
- The window list has gotten a facelift.
- Can't seem to make up my mind: Renamed dbx.tar.gz to default.tar.gz so that the old default.tar.gz should be overwritten and users using the default theme will be exposed to the new theme.
- Forgot to change default.tar.gz to dbx.tar.gz.

Version 0.40
- README and CHANGELOG updated.
- Translations updated.

- Renamed the default theme (the new one) to DBX so that it wouldn't use custom colors from the old default theme.
- Fixed a bug that caused dockbarx to pick a custom theme instead of the default theme if the by user chosen theme is missing or corrupt (a random theme is supposed to be picked only if the default theme as well is missing or corrupt).
- Fix bug (from rev 298) that caused dockbarx to behave wierdly when closing windows.

- Changed the default theme. The new default theme is made by BigRZA. The old default theme is renamed 'Old'.
- Added the sunny colors theme by BigRZA because it's the most beautiful theme made for dark panels out there (IMHO, of course).
- Removed human_bar theme since it's pretty much an older version of the default theme.
-BugFix: DockbarX are now removing windows that are set to skip_taskbar and adding windows that isn't skip_taskbar anymore. This should fix Bug #505395, #661819 and #669711.
- Bug fix: recent and most used menu still only showed five results even though they are supposed to show eight.
- Bug fix: DockbarX crashed if a launcher without a command line had been added.
- updated changelog

issue_comments.body: There is a menu applet. You can use cardapio within DockX, if you have cardapio installed.

Hello,

Cardapio currently is no longer maintained / no longer in development according to:

https://launchpad.net/cardapio/+announcement/11268

And the Cardapio PPA has also not been updated for Ubuntu 14.04 LTS "Trusty Tahr" as far as I can see:

https://launchpad.net/~cardapio-team/+archive/cardapio-ppa

So I don't see how the Caradapio applet inside DockX would help me.

Any alternative?

Regards

I think Webupd8 has cardapio in its ppa. It is quite well functioning even though it's not maintained.

Thanks for reporting. 
There's small bug that causes an error in that snippet. If that's the whole problem it is easily fixed. I pushed the fix to the branch hotfix-0.91.4 so you can try it or if you installed through ppa or some other packaging system and don't want to install dockbarx manually, you could simply edit `/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.7/dockbarx/iconfactory.py` and add these two line before line 715.

``` python
            w = surface.get_width()
            h = surface.get_height()
```

That's the whole fix. Please tell me if it works so that I know if I should make a new release containing this fix. (The bug is related to the theme you are using so please try it with the same theme as before.)

Added the fix, logged out/logged in, and it is fixed! I can now hide show a
window without issue.

Thanks!

Sent from my Android device with K-9 Mail. Please excuse my brevity.
Indeed, there's a fixed Cardapio available in the main WebUpd8 PPA. See step 5 from here: http://www.webupd8.org/2014/04/how-to-install-and-tweak-gnome.html
I can confirm the bug and will look into it.

Hi, there! I've made some mockups of a much cleaner design. I love this dock but the settings dialogue has always been a bit daunting. I hope I can be useful!

I made sure every option is still configurable but some are done in a more humanistic way. I got lazy near the end and didn't do the other two tabs for mouse/keyboard and I still haven't done the popup dialogues that are activated with the 'gear' icon. If this is agreeable, the skeleton (and much of the meat) is all there. I changed only a few words around, I figured we could work on the language after the design has been implemented.

Also, I hope that lightswitches is an acceptable widget to use; I'm not sure if you support GTK2 or GTK3. If not GTK3, we can make do without them.

Thanks so much for such an amazing piece of software.  

Some suggestions for the present:

Firstly, right clicking on the bar to configure says 'properties'. Properties is a word defining an object and gives no indication to configure the dockbar. 'Configure' or 'Customize' would be better terminology. 

Secondly, the configuration window should not have a 'close' button: that's what the x is for at the top-right of your window!

How liberal shall I be on filing bug reports/pull requests?

On my singling of themes in the 'appearance' pane, my rationale is thusly: User can select from available themes with the single drop-down menu. If the user has any desires to mix-and-match components or change colors, s/he may then open the configuration prompt (adjacent cog) and adjust to desires. If the user does customize the theme like this, then the main drop-down menu will display Custom. Also, on the subject of the 'Needs attention effect' - the water ripples should only be presented to the user if Compiz is installed on the system. And as for keyboard shortcuts/Mouse bindings, it is more useful to be able to click a button and map the configuration like in Gnome's keyboard binding settings or Compiz's settings manager. As you might have noted, the window itself does not need to be as tall as my mockups - I had just left extra space in case I needed expansion. If anything is not clear, please do speak up.

If you have installed anything manually, those files will be used even if you install from a ppa later. Manual installs install in /usr/local/lib while the ppas installs the files in /usr/lib and the former is used over the later.

If you want to use the ppa instead of manual install you need to delete the files that the manual install made. Run the manual install again and see where it puts the files and remove them. Unfortunately there's no uninstall options in the setup system that Dockbarx uses.
